docs.title: Fountain CMS Onboarding Guide
docs.text: This guide helps new users become productive in Fountain quickly and safely.

docs.title: Audience
docs.text:
• Content editors creating show pages and event listings
  • Publishers preparing and launching content
  • Team members updating collections and home page modules

docs.title: How To Use This Guide
docs.text:
1. Start with Quickstart.
  2. Follow Core Workflows for common tasks.
  3. Use Troubleshooting if you hit errors.
  4. Copy approved templates from Snippets and Reference.
  5. Run Launch Checklist before publishing.

docs.title: First Week Outcomes
docs.text:
By the end of week one, a new user should be able to:

  • Create a Show and fill required title/date fields
  • Configure right-rail controls safely for launch
  • Add images, captions, and PDF assets correctly
  • Preview content in the correct template URL
  • Apply ticketing setup for single-date and multi-date events
  • Resolve common service/cache and broken-link issues

docs.title: Fountain Areas You Will Use Most
docs.text:
• Shows: create and maintain show pages
  • Events: auto-generated instances tied to show dates
  • Collections: home page and landing page modules
  • Assets: upload images and PDF files
  • CMS: San Juan Hill content area

docs.title: Important Operating Rules
docs.text:
• Keep new content Invisible until approved.
  • Use relative URLs where directed (for internal page links).
  • For imported organizations (Film, LC Theater, Juilliard), default organization to Lincoln Center unless told otherwise.
  • For date style, use :00 where needed and avoid spaces around en dashes.

docs.title: Documentation Maintenance
docs.text:
If your team updates CMS behavior, update these files in the same pull request:

  • quickstart.md
  • workflows.md
  • troubleshooting.md
  • snippets-reference.md
  • launch-checklist.md

docs.title: Fountain Launch Checklist
docs.text: Use this before switching visibility to live.

docs.title: Content
docs.text:
• Show title and supporting H3/H3_2 are complete
  • Date line follows house style (:00, clean en dashes)
  • Description reviewed for accuracy
  • Button URL points to correct destination

docs.title: Media
docs.text:
• Desktop image is correctly cropped
  • Mobile image uploaded when needed
  • Caption and photo credit are present
  • PDFs are linked with tested URLs

docs.title: Metadata / Controls
docs.text:
• Display in Section is correct (Events for live events)
  • Is Featured set intentionally
  • Hide from On Demand set correctly
  • Add to Calendar enabled when appropriate
  • Tags (Free, Family, venue, series, genre) are complete

docs.title: Ticketing
docs.text:
• Single-date vs multi-date setup is correct
  • Ticket URLs tested
  • Ticket copy/language reviewed

docs.title: QA and Approval
docs.text:
• Page preview checked in correct template
  • Internal and external links tested
  • Stakeholder approval confirmed
  • Visibility switched from Invisible only after approval

docs.title: Fountain Quickstart (New User)
docs.text: Use this checklist to create and prep your first Show safely.

docs.title: 1. Create The Show
docs.text:
1. Go to Shows > Create New Show.
  2. Fill Title Block fields:
  3. H3: series name (usually linked)
  4. H1: show title
  5. H3_2: presenting organization (usually linked)
  6. Add Conversational Date Range (day/date/time + relevant info).
  7. Add Description.
  8. If no description is available yet, enter a placeholder space so required validation passes.

docs.title: 2. Configure Core Fields
docs.text:
1. Button URL:
  2. Use a relative URL for internal redirects.
  3. Venue Map:
  4. Paste Google Maps embed code.
  5. If needed, use map snippets from snippets-reference.md.
  6. Organization:
  7. For imported content, prefer Lincoln Center unless instructed otherwise.

docs.title: 3. Add Image Correctly
docs.text:
1. Upload image in Image Select.
  2. Save the Show.
  3. Re-open the Show.
  4. Add image caption and photo credit.

docs.title: 4. Set Right-Rail Controls
docs.text:
1. Display in Section: set to Events for live events.
  2. Is Featured: keep No unless specifically required.
  3. Hide from On Demand: set Hide for live events.
  4. Enable Add to Calendar: generally Enable.
  5. Visibility: keep Invisible until approval.
  6. Add tags (Free, Family, venue, series, genre as applicable).

docs.title: 5. Preview Before Launch
docs.text:
1. Save content.
  2. Re-open and click Preview.
  3. If template is wrong, adjust URL pattern:
  4. Atrium events: http://preview.lincolncenter.org/venue/atrium/<your-page-slug>
  5. Summer in the City: http://preview.lincolncenter.org/series/summer-for-the-city/<your-page-slug>

docs.title: 6. Ticketing Setup
docs.text:
• Single date: remove Ticket URL from Basics and put it on Ticketing tab button(s).
  • Multiple dates: add first URL in Basics, then date-specific URLs on Dates tab.

docs.title: 7. Final Pre-Publish Check
docs.text:
• Content copy reviewed
  • Image/crop appropriate
  • Links tested
  • Visibility still Invisible
  • Stakeholder approval received
  • Then switch visibility for launch

docs.title: Fountain Snippets And Reference
docs.text: Use this file as your operational reference for copy/paste standards.

docs.title: Image Format Rules
docs.text: • Accepted file types: JPG, PNG

docs.title: Core Crop Sizes
docs.text:
• Show pages and old series pages: 1600x900
  • Calendar listings: 650x366
  • LincolnCenter.org page templates: 1673x600
  • New series header art: 1756x408
  • New sub-series header art: 1756x615
  • Series landing circular modules: 500x500
  • Series landing square modules: 600x600
  • Collections marketing module: 700x700
  • Press room: 906x453

docs.title: Ticketing Copy Snippet
docs.text: <p>Ticketing information to be announced at a later date; please check back closer to the event.</p>

docs.title: No Late Seating Copy Snippet
docs.text: Please note: There will be no late seating; ticket-holders, please arrive on time.

docs.text: <em>If you require any additional accommodations, please contact <a href="mailto:access@lincolncenter.org">access@lincolncenter.org</a> or <a href="tel:+12128755375">212-875-5375</a>.</em>

docs.text: <p>If you have any questions about this performance, please contact Guest Services at <a href="tel:+12128755456">212-875-5456</a> or <a href="mailto:guestservices@lincolncenter.org">guestservices@lincolncenter.org</a>.</p>

docs.title: Service Unavailable Error
docs.text:
If only you are seeing it:

  1. Clear browser cache.
  2. Open Create New Show and test if it loads.
  3. Log out and back in.

docs.title: Preview Not Matching Expected Template
docs.text:
1. Save the page.
  2. Re-open and click Preview.
  3. Replace URL path with expected template pattern (Atrium, Summer in the City, venue template).

docs.title: Broken PDF Link After Upload
docs.text:
Cause:

  • Asset may have been re-saved and URL changed.

Fix:

  1. Open asset record.
  2. Copy current File Location URL.
  3. Replace broken link in content.
  4. Re-test link.

docs.title: Missing Show In Search
docs.text:
1. Enable Show past shows in filters.
  2. Re-run search.

docs.title: Ticketing Button Appears Incorrectly
docs.text:
1. Verify single-date vs multi-date setup.
  2. Single-date: button URL in Ticketing tab.
  3. Multi-date: first URL in Basics, date-specific URLs in Dates tab.

docs.title: Image Not Correct On Mobile
docs.text:
1. Open image asset manager after initial save.
  2. Upload alternate mobile image.
  3. Re-test on mobile viewport.

docs.title: A. Create A Show End-To-End
docs.text:
1. Create Show in Shows.
  2. Fill Title Block (H3, H1, H3_2).
  3. Complete date, description, and button URL.
  4. Set venue map and organization.
  5. Upload image, save, re-open, then add caption/credit.
  6. Set right-rail controls and tags.
  7. Preview on correct template URL.
  8. Keep invisible until approved.

docs.title: B. Shows vs. Events
docs.text:
• Shows contain full descriptive content.
  • Events are generated instances for performance dates.
  • If you remove a performance date:
  • Remove it in the Show.
  • Find and delete the associated Event.

docs.title: C. Search Older/Running Shows
docs.text:
When a show started in the past but is still active:

  1. Open show filters.
  2. Enable Show past shows.
  3. Re-run search.

docs.title: D. Link To A Filtered Calendar (Mini-Series)
docs.text:
Use this path format:

  • /series/lincoln-center-presents/v/calendar/s/Talk

Adjust the final filter term to your intended category.

docs.title: E. Atrium Template Redirect
docs.text:
For Atrium events, set Button URL to:

  • /venue/atrium/<show-slug>

This forces the proper template behavior.

docs.title: F. Edit Home Page Collection
docs.text:
Home page location:

  • Collections > Lincoln Center at Home 2.0

Guidelines:

  • Keep date formatting consistent (:00, clean en dashes).
  • Use alternate mobile image when needed (upload image, save, reopen asset manager).
  • Marketing modules: a third module can be added at bottom via display after highlights.

docs.title: G. Upload PDF Assets
docs.text:
1. Go to Assets > Create new asset.
  2. Choose Upload PDF.
  3. Save and copy URL from File Location.
  4. Test URL before publishing.

Important:

  • Avoid clicking save repeatedly after upload; repeated saves can generate a new URL and break old links.
